unnormalised: IMD predicts heavy rainfall in Mumbai on 15/07/2024. The monsoon season is expected to intensify, with potential waterlogging in low-lying areas. Citizens are advised to avoid unnecessary travel after 6 PM.
normalised: I-M-D predicts heavy rainfall in Mumbai on fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four. The monsoon season is expected to intensify, with potential waterlogging in low-lying areas. Citizens are advised to avoid unnecessary travel after six P-M.

unnormalised: A red alert has been issued for coastal Karnataka and Kerala from 16/07/2024 to 18/07/2024. Wind speeds may reach 70 kmph, posing a threat to fishermen. The high tide is expected at 11:30 AM on 17/7/24.
normalised: A red alert has been issued for coastal Karnataka and Kerala from sixteenth July two thousand and twenty four to eighteenth July two thousand and twenty four. Wind speeds may reach seventy kilometer per hour, posing a threat to fishermen. The high tide is expected at eleven thirty A-M on seventeenth July two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Delhi is expected to experience a slight dip in temperature to 32Â°C on 20/07/2024. However, humidity levels will remain high, making it uncomfortable. The weather forecast predicts a cloudy sky for the entire week.
normalised: Delhi is expected to experience a slight dip in temperature to thirty two degree celsius on twentieth July two thousand and twenty four. However, humidity levels will remain high, making it uncomfortable. The weather forecast predicts a cloudy sky for the entire week.

unnormalised: The next weather update will be released by the IMD on 14/07/2024 at 4:00 PM IST. Citizens are urged to stay informed about the changing weather conditions and take necessary precautions. The temperature in Chennai is expected to be around 35 degrees Celcius.
normalised: The next weather update will be released by the I-M-D on fourteenth July two thousand and twenty four at four zero zero P-M I-S-T. Citizens are urged to stay informed about the changing weather conditions and take necessary precautions. The temperature in Chennai is expected to be around thirty five degrees Celsius.
